titleStmt.title: Charles Hubberd to James W. Tate
CWG7877

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Columbus Ky
Jan 31st 1863.
James W. Tate Esq.
Asst Secy State Ky.

Dear Sir, Yours of the 21st came to hand just now. I am sojourning for a time in this City. I enclose one Doll.; please get me appd by Gov. & Senate for Fulton & Hickman Counties if it can be legally done, if not, get the appt for Fulton County alone, & forward me the commission to this City. While absent from Hickman I have a Deputy there, my son in law, James M. Linley M. D., who is a true Union Man.

Very Respectfully Yours
Charles Hubberd M. D.
